title: Roast squash and goat’s cheese hand pies recipe
text:
I like the notion of ‘hand pies’, little pies that are the size of your palm and can be eaten out of your hand. Make sure to put the slashes in the pieces of pastry for the tops, otherwise the pies will split round the sides as they bake.

The pastry recipe here is from Cathy Barrow’s book, When Pies Fly, and is delicious – rich and buttery, but robust enough for pies that you want to transport.

Fillings for pies have to be assertively seasoned because they’re wrapped in pastry, otherwise they can taste bland.

Prep time: 30 minutes, plus chilling time | Cooking time: 55 minutes

MAKES

12

INGREDIENTS

For the pastry
description: I like the notion of ‘hand pies’, little pies that are the size of your palm and can be eaten out of your hand.
